alert.note: Alert for Canovanas; Loiza; Rio Grande (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 08 at 7:59AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Canovanas, Loiza and Rio Grande. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 757 AM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to a line of thunderstorms moving over the area from the east. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - As this line of thunderstorms spread across the area, expect additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rio Grande, Canovanas, Carolina, Vieques, La Dolores, Campo Rico, San Isidro, Hato Candal, Santa Barbara, Bartolo, Palmer, Benitez and Lomas.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
